description:
Don’t get caught in the dark. From the next power outage, to getting into camp later than expected, the Torch 500 has a 300 lumen flashlight, and a 150 lumen lantern to help light your way. There are plenty of lighting modes that will take you from playing cards, to “what was that?” With both a USB-C port and an integrated solar panel, you've got options on how to charge your light. And you can even use the internal battery to top up your phone.

  • 8 lighting modes: spot - 75 lumens (50h), 150 lumens (7.5h), 300 lumens (3.5h), flood – 75 lumens (50h), 150 lumens (7h), 300 lumens (3h), and both lights – 250 lumens (4.5h), 500 lumens (2h)
  • Charge times are 4 hours via USB or 23-46 hours via the solar panel
  • USB-A port (output): 5V, up to 2.1A (10.5W max), regulated
  • USB-C port (input): 5V, up to 1A (5W max)
  • Temperature operating range is 0-40°C
  • 2 integrated hanger hooks make a secure loop, or can be used on their own
  • IP67 weatherproofing keeps you light shining bright in any weather you're willing to go out in
  • In the box: Torch 500, USB-A to USB-C cable, and documentation
name: Goal Zero Torch 500 Emergency Light
